item.description:
• We invite you to join us for an outdoor event on the beautiful Boston Esplanade by the Charles river in the heart of the city. We will be working alongside the horticulturist from the Boston Esplanade on park maintenance as well as invasive plant removal; We may be painting benches if weather and time permits. All gloves and tools will be provided, but please bring water.  This is a great opportunity to give back to the city as the entire Boston Esplanade is taken care of by a single horticulturist, and we can really make a difference by helping out.

     

    Time: 8.45 AM to 12 PM. Please be on time, we will be walking to a work site away from the meeting point above. We suggest bringing water.

     

    Closest T Stop : Copley (Green Line). After getting off the T stop, Walk along  the Dartmouth Street, towards the river. You will pass Newbury street, Commonwealth Avenue, Beacon Street and then Back Street. At the junction of Back Street and Dartmouth, you will see the Dartmouth Street footbridge, cross over the Dartmouth Street footbridge, which will put you in front of the Dartmouth Street Comfort station.

     

     

    We look forward to volunteering with you,

     

     

    Learn More:

    www.BostonVolunteer.org

    Connect with us:

     

    P.S. Please friend Paulette:http://www.facebook.com/paulette.revere.7

group.name: Boston Volunteers. Big enough 2 deliver, small enough 2 care

item.name: Boston Esplanade: Park Maintenance and Invasive Plant Removal
